original: Once shoots develop roots and become independent from the mother plant, they are classified as distinct entities. This concept draws a parallel between societal structures and plant reproduction, suggesting that societies are more closely related to plants than to animals. In this analogy, there is no clear distinction between parent and offspring, as seen in the branching nature of societal development, which resembles vegetative repro
